dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Fifteen billion dollars in crypto assets have left Kazakhstan, according to Deputy Governor Berik Sholpankulov.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifteen billion dollars in crypto assets have left Kazakhstan, according to Deputy Governor Berik Sholpankulov.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: About $15 billion worth of crypto assets has been moved out of Kazakhstan, Deputy Governor of the National Bank Berik Sholpankulov said at a briefing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a staggering amount, and he's saying the legal framework just wasn't ready for safe investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a staggering amount, and he's saying the legal framework just wasn't ready for safe investment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "The issue was that the administrative and legal framework was insufficiently developed for citizens to safely invest in such assets," he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, the administrative and legal side was underdeveloped, so people moved their assets out, uh, to where they felt it was safer or less restricted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, the administrative and legal side was underdeveloped, so people moved their assets out, uh, to where they felt it was safer or less restricted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now they're working on new legislation to regulate the digital asset market better, right? To prevent illegal outflows.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they're working on new legislation to regulate the digital asset market better, right? To prevent illegal outflows.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Sholpankulov, Kazakhstan is now working on legislative approaches to better regulate the digital asset market. A key priority is to prevent the illegal outflow of funds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they've actually developed these approaches already—criminal and administrative prosecution for anyone trying to move funds illegally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they've actually developed these approaches already-criminal and administrative prosecution for anyone trying to move funds illegally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "These approaches have already been developed, and they will be implemented. The second part involves criminal and administrative prosecution of those who, as you say, are attempting to illegally transfer funds," he noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He even mentioned that, in the future, they'll be able to trace where assets went using international monitoring systems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He even mentioned that, in the future, they'll be able to trace where assets went using international monitoring systems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deputy governor added that, in the future, it will be possible to identify and trace where the assets were moved thanks to technological capabilities provided by international crypto transaction monitoring systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is huge—imagine being able to name names publicly at a briefing, like who spent what in the so-called 'gray zone.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is huge-imagine being able to name names publicly at a briefing, like who spent what in the so-called 'gray zone.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "We may hold another briefing and announce, by name, who spent what and where in the 'gray zone'. That would fall under criminal and administrative prosecution," he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But at the moment, they don't have leads on that fifteen billion, do they? He said 'not at the moment.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But at the moment, they don't have leads on that fifteen billion, do they? He said 'not at the moment.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When asked whether authorities had any leads on the previously withdrawn $15 billion. "Not at the moment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but once they join the monitoring system, they'll be able to see everything—which wallets, where funds are stored, all of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but once they join the monitoring system, they'll be able to see everything-which wallets, where funds are stored, all of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But once we join the relevant system, we'll be able to see it and inform you. Perhaps we'll announce a separate briefing to report who did what, where funds are stored, and which wallets are operating in the illegal space.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So the capability is there technologically; it's just a matter of time before they implement it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the capability is there technologically; it's just a matter of time before they implement it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The technological capability exists " we just need time," Sholpankulov responded.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he also dismissed those social media rumors about unexplained bank withdrawals as completely unfounded.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he also dismissed those social media rumors about unexplained bank withdrawals as completely unfounded.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Deputy Governor of the National Bank Berik Sholpankulov dismissed as rumors recent claims circulating on social media about unexplained withdrawals from citizens' bank accounts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like they're really trying to get a handle on this and bring some transparency to crypto movements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like they're really trying to get a handle on this and bring some transparency to crypto movements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It'll be interesting to see if they actually follow through with naming individuals publicly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It'll be interesting to see if they actually follow through with naming individuals publicly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. That kind of accountability could be a game-changer for regulating crypto in the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. That kind of accountability could be a game-changer for regulating crypto in the region.
